verdict.summary: A context was explicitly canceled via CancelFunc before the operation completed. This is often caused by premature cancellation in request handlers or parent context cancellation propagating to child operations.

dead_ends.action: Ignore the context cancellation and retry immediately
dead_ends.why_fails: If the parent context is canceled, all child contexts are also canceled — retrying with the same context will fail instantly

dead_ends.action: Remove cancel() defer calls to prevent cancellation
dead_ends.why_fails: Skipping cancel() causes resource leaks — the goroutine and its resources are never freed

workarounds.action: Use a detached context for background operations that must outlive the request
workarounds.how: Use context.WithoutCancel(ctx) (Go 1.21+) or context.Background() for operations that should not be canceled when the parent request ends.

workarounds.action: Check ctx.Err() before starting expensive operations to fail fast

leads_to.condition: when cancel is replaced with a timeout

preceded_by.condition: when server shutdown cancels in-flight request contexts

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'context canceled' means explicit CancelFunc was called, while 'context deadline exceeded' means a timeout or deadline expired.
